headline: One month after Maduro's abduction in Venezuela, the transition of power is unclear
subhead: While Delcy Rodriguez, whom Donald Trump approved to replace Nicolas Maduro at the start of January, appears to be meeting Washington's expectations, it is still impossible to know whether this situation will open up space for democracy.

headline: Clintons to testify in US House-led Epstein investigation
Trump announces US trade deal with India, which has 'agreed to stop buying Russian oil'
Mark Carney, a prime minister seeking to free Canada from US dominance
subhead: As the international order weakens, the Canadian leader has moved on from the Trudeau era, when his predecessor was seen as naive on the world stage, and to assert himself against hegemonic powers – starting with his American neighbor.

headline: 'Trump has struck at the heart of the defense pact forged between the US and Europe in 1949: Trust'
subhead: The drama surrounding Donald Trump's willingness to annex Greenland, by force or by negotiation, has dealt a lasting blow to NATO's credibility, explains columnist Alain Frachon.

headline: At the Paris Panthéon, artist Nicolas Daubanes turns to 10 sites of memory
subhead: With his striking suspended magnetic powder drawings, this history enthusiast evokes French national sites marked by contemporary conflicts that have since become memorials.

headline: Comic books: After Angoulême, a new French festival shows promise
subhead: After the International Comic Book Festival's 53rd edition was canceled, in Angoulême, southwestern France, the Grand Off and Interconnected Comic Book Festivals, conducted in around 15 European cities, kept the art alive.
byline: Adrien Le Gal,  Frédéric Potet and  Pauline Croquet

subhead: This 37-year-old woman, deeply involved in the nonprofit sector and a supporter of independence for the Danish autonomous territory, has established herself as one of the leading figures in the protests against Donald Trump's expansionist ambitions.

headline: An AI clone and a publicly traded company: The irresistible rise of TikToker Khaby Lame
subhead: The Senegalese-Italian influencer has sold his company for nearly $1 billion in a deal that includes the creation of a digital twin powered by artificial intelligence.

headline: Two years after France introduced specialized units to combat domestic violence, results are mixed
subhead: The French Justice Ministry says most judicial and appeal courts have set up these units, which aim to provide a cross-disciplinary approach to handling domestic violence cases. On the ground, however, advocacy groups and lawyers remain cautious about the reform's impact.
